definitions.example: The use of torture has been condemned by the United Nations.

definitions.definition: The act of consuming alcohol or narcotics.

definitions.example: What's the use of a law that nobody follows?

definitions.definition: A function; a purpose for which something may be employed.
Occasion or need to employ; necessity.
definitions.example: I have no further use for these textbooks.

definitions.definition: Interest for lent money; premium paid for the use of something; usury.
Continued or repeated practice; usage; habit.
The special form of ritual adopted for use in any diocese.
definitions.example: the Sarum, or Canterbury, use; the Hereford use; the York use; the Roman use; etc.

definitions.definition: (forging) A slab of iron welded to the side of a forging, such as a shaft, near the end, and afterward drawn down, by hammering, so as to lengthen the forging.
To accustom; to habituate. (Now common only in participial form. Uses the same pronunciation as the noun; see usage notes.)
definitions.example: soldiers who are used to hardships and danger

definitions.definition: (except in past tense) To habitually do; to be wont to do. (Now chiefly in past-tense forms; see used to.)
definitions.example: I used to get things done.

definitions.definition: To behave toward; to act with regard to; to treat.
A form of equitable ownership peculiar to English law, by which one person enjoys the profits of lands, etc. whose legal title is vested in another in trust.
